awd_titl_txt: Analysis of Structural Debris Generation and Disposal After Hurricane Andrew from Social, Technical and Institutional   Perspectives
awd_abstract_narration: The purpose of this post-disaster                                               study is to qualitatively and                                                   quantitatively identify and analyze                                             the structural debris generated                                                 after Hurricane Andrew in relation                                              to the characteristics of the                                                   hurricane, the type of construction                                             and the land use in South Dade                                                  County.  In addition, the social,                                               technical and institutional                                                     problems encountered during the                                                 removal and disposal of the                                                     structural debris caused by the                                                 hurricane will be analyzed.  The                                                findings from this work will help                                               mitigate the magnitude and effects                                              of this type of debris produced by                                              extreme wind episodes.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
